title: St. Paul's to St. Sophia;
author: McCormick, Richard C.
snippet: The person's name was Cook, and he claimed relationship to the intrepid voyager, and assured Mr. Lamb it had always been the belief of the family that the said James Cook came from this part of the country, and on leaving it had taken up his residence at Ayton in Berwickshire, and subsequently at Martin, Cleveland, where the future captain was born.

title: Hill-side and border sketches:
author: Maxwell, W. H.
snippet: Indeed, the character given of the Irish in the district between Ayton and Dunbar is deplorable.
